comment: Smart Data Models - Energy / Three Phase AC Measurement adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Energy/master/ThreePhaseAcMeasurement/schema.json
description: An electrical  measurement from a system that uses three phase alternating current.

contents.name: dateEnergyMeteringStarted1
contents.comment: The starting date for metering energy.

contents.name: dateModified1
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: activeEnergyImport1
contents.comment: Active energy imported i.e. consumed per phase since the metering start date. The actual values will be conveyed by subproperties which names will be equal to the name of each of the alternating current phases: L1, L2, L3.

contents.name: activePower1
contents.comment: The actual values will beconveyed by subproperties which names will be equal to the name of each of the alternating current phases: L1, L2, L3.

contents.name: current1
contents.comment: Electrical current. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase and the neutral wire: L1, L2, L3 and N.

contents.name: powerFactor1
contents.comment: Power factor for each phase. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase: L1, L2 and L3
